Twitter        Facebook     Windows Live     Yahoo                 MySpace     Email                   Bread Crumbs                Home          >           Academics          >           Courses          >           Course Detail                                        Introduction to Dramatic Writing: The Short Play                                Semester and Year        FA 2015                    Course Number        ARTS-UG1560                    Section        001                    Instructor        Darrel Alejandro Holnes                    Days                            Wed                                 Time                            6:20 PM -       9:00 PM                                Units        4.0                    Level        U                    Foundation Requirement                                                  Description       In this arts workshop we will learn the basics of playwriting by examining the work of Aristotle as well as plays by major writers including Anton Chekov, Oscar Wilde, and others. Our goal will be to develop and revise a short play through a variety of writing exercises and techniques and the study of plays in  24 Favorite One-Act Plays  and the  Best 10-Minute Plays of 2014  . This course will also feature guest lectures by a diverse group of working playwrights and theater professionals and the viewing of a Broadway and Off-Broadway show. Upon completing this course you will have a working body of short dramatic writing and learn how to submit your work to student and professional festivals and contests worldwide. Short Screen Play: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Writing The Short Screen Play  FMTV-UT.1020 Studio 4 Credits Course Level: Intermediate     Prerequisite: Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing (H56.0033) or Dramatic and Visual Writing II (H56.0032) or Script Writing II (H56.0056), offered in the Summer. Course may be repeated.    This workshop is devoted solely to screenplays from 10-30 minutes in length, that can be directed in Intermediate or Advanced Production classes. Students are assisted in exploring, developing, and writing appropriate material, from idea to finished script. Work can either be in narrative or non-narrative form. Scriptwriting: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Scriptwriting  Students must complete 3 courses for not less than 12 points. *    Some courses may not be offered in a given academic year. Consult each semester’s schedule for specific information. Click on a course title below to read the course description.       *Please note that only students who began the Film & TV Program as of Fall 1999 have to complete the new 12-point minimum requirement. (This is due to the fact that Storytelling Strategies changed from a 2 point introductory writing course to a 4 point course beginning in Fall '99.) Students admitted in Fall 1998 have to complete 3 courses for a minimum of 10 points. Students admitted BEFORE Fall 1998 must complete 2 writing courses for a minumum of 8 points.    Courses not currently being offered:    Advanced Sketch Writing I & II Dramatic and Visual Writing I & II Writing the Feature Film Writing Through Collaboration    Courses Currently Offered: Adaptation : A Screenwriting Workshop Advanced Television Writing: One Hour Drama Comedy Writing for Film and Television Developing the Screenplay Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing Introduction to Television Writing Preparing the Screenplay Research and Writing for Documentary Script Analysis Storytelling Strategies Writing for Advanced Television Production Workshop Writing for Animation Writing for Children's Television Writing for Television: Situation & Sketch Comedy Writing The Short Screen Play           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
